lines.text: Enter CAPULET, LADY  CAPULET, Nurse, and two Servingmen

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: So many guests invite as here are writ. Sirrah, go hire me twenty cunning cooks.
Exit First Servant

lines.speaker: second servant
lines.text: You shall have none ill, sir for Ill try if they can lick their fingers.

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: How canst thou try them so

lines.speaker: second servant
lines.text: Marry, sir, tis an ill cook that cannot lick his own fingers: therefore he that cannot lick his fingers goes not with me.

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: Go, be gone. We shall be much unfurnished for this time. What, is my daughter gone to Friar Laurence
Exit Second Servant

lines.speaker: nurse
lines.text: Ay, forsooth.

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: Well, he may chance to do some good on her: A peevish selfwilld harlotry it is.

lines.speaker: nurse
lines.text: See where she comes from shrift with merry look.
Enter JULIET

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: How now, my headstrong! where have you been gadding

lines.speaker: juliet
lines.text: Where I have learnd me to repent the sin Of disobedient opposition To you and your behests, and am enjoind By holy Laurence to fall prostrate here, And beg your pardon: pardon, I beseech you! Henceforward I am ever ruled by you.

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: Send for the county go tell him of this: Ill have this knot knit up tomorrow morning.

lines.speaker: juliet
lines.text: I met the youthful lord at Laurence cell And gave him what becomed love I might, Not step oer the bounds of modesty.

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: Why, I am glad ont this is well: stand up: This is ast should be. Let me see the county Ay, marry, go, I say, and fetch him hither. Now, afore God! this reverend holy friar, Our whole city is much bound to him.

lines.speaker: juliet
lines.text: Nurse, will you go with me into my closet, To help me sort such needful ornaments As you think fit to furnish me tomorrow

lines.speaker: lady capulet
lines.text: No, not till Thursday there is time enough.

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: Go, nurse, go with her: well to church tomorrow.
Exeunt JULIET and Nurse

lines.speaker: lady  capulet
lines.text: We shall be short in our provision: Tis now near night.

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: Tush, I will stir about, And all things shall be well, I warrant thee, wife: Go thou to Juliet, help to deck up her Ill not to bed tonight let me alone Ill play the housewife for this once. What, ho! They are all forth. Well, I will walk myself To County Paris, to prepare him up Against tomorrow: my heart is wondrous light, Since this same wayward girl is so reclaimd.
Exeunt
